data.title: Oktoberfest Retro Template
data.meta_description: Discover how Katie Mills-Harvey does Oktoberfest Retro in Miro with Miroverse, the Miro Community Templates Gallery. View Katie Mills-Harvey's Miro templates.
data.text:
ü•®üç∫üå≠ü•®üç∫üå≠

Who's ready for Oktoberfest?

Celebrated annually, across the world, Oktoberfest is a festival held in Munich, Bavaria, Germany. The festival originates with a party held in celebration of a royal marriage. On October 12, 1810, Kronprinz Ludwig (later King Ludwig I of Bavaria) married the Princess Therese of Saxe-Hildburghausen in Munich. Typically Oktoberfest is celebrated with steins of beer, pretzels and other german foods.

This template takes the best of Oktoberfest and celebrates it in a retro format! Looking at what happened in the closing sprint as well as what risks and issues the team foresees in its future.

The template also features my usual temp checks and activity, in the form of a virtual pub! Feel free to have your team members bring a beverage and enjoy a happy hour after the retro to get the full Oktoberfest feel!

‚ú®Facilitator notes: There is no prep work needed for this template. Just open and go! ‚ú®

Used it? Loved it?

I'd love to hear your feedback on this template or any others I've published. Feel free to reach out to me on LinkedIn below.

Happy Retro-ing!

https://www.linkedin.com/in/k88mills/
